description.value:
Allows you to assign an id to your app, which is used in a number of places. The element with this attribute is called the **Mavo root**.

On: Mavo root
Names elements that will be saved, edited, or used in [expressions](https://mavo.io/docs/expressions). Elements with this attribute are called **Properties**.

Tells Mavo where data is stored. Itâ€™s used on the Mavo root with any of the accepted values or optionally on individual properties to prevent them from being stored (`mv-storage="none"`).

On: Mavo root, properties

Live: yes

The value of this property element is not just an attribute or its text content, but the union of the values of the properties inside it. This is almost always inferred from the structure of your properties and added automatically, but you can use it to force an element to be a group, or to declare the type of the group (e.g. `typeof="Person"`) for better semantic value. Elements with this attribute are called **groups**, objects, or complex properties.

On: Properties

Makes elements repeatable. Only has meaning on property elements, if there is no `property` attribute, one will be added automatically with a generated name like "collection". Elements with this attribute are called **Collections**.	

On: Properties

Override the defaults for which attribute holds the data for this element. For no attribute (element content), specify `"none"`.

On: Properties, elements with `mv-value`

Run an action that modifies the data when an element is clicked or a form is submitted.

Live: expressions

If specified, it is used instead of `mv-storage` for loading data. Useful when you want to read from one location and write to a different location. Same values as `mv-storage`.

On: Mavo root

Live: yes

If no data is stored, `mv-init` will be used to load initial data. Same values as `mv-storage`.

On: Mavo root

Live: yes

Sets the default value. If no value, the default value becomes the property content.

On: Properties

Live: yes

Values: `desc` or `asc`. Controls the order that new items are added to collections.

On: Collections
Change the expression syntax or disable [expressions](https://mavo.io/docs/expressions) altogether.
Disable expressions on specific attributes

Set an element's content to the result of an [expressions](https://mavo.io/docs/expressions/#providing-fallbacks-the-mv-value-attribute).

Live: expressions

Remove an element from the DOM if the expression doesn't match and re-add it when it does.

Live: expressions

Property names (space separated) of other collections that can move items to this one.

On: Collections

Customize how an element is edited by linking to another element, anywhere in the page.

On: Properties

Live: initially

Any attributes set this way will be copied over to the property's editor.

On: Properties

Live: initially

Control whether a property is in read or edit mode independently of the mode of the rest of the Mavo app.

Live: yes

Render and edit only a subset of the remote data, by providing a (slash-separated) path to the data it handles.

On: Mavo root

Live: initially

Save automatically when the data changes, either immediately or at most every N seconds.

On: Mavo root

Live: initially

Control which buttons may appear in the toolbar and in what order, or hide the toolbar completely.

On: Mavo root

Render and edit only a subset of the stored data.

On: Properties

Live: initially

Same as `mv-path` but applies to the collection itself, not the item(s).

On: Collections

If provided, Mavo will read data from this property **instead** of its real property name. Useful to read stored data properly after renaming a property in the HTML.

On: Properties

How many items should the collection start with? If not provided, it is 1, unless `mv-like` is also specified, in which case it's 0 (to prevent infinite recursion).

On: Collections

Sets the local path for uploads. Mandatory to enable uploads on `<a>` and `<link>`.

On: Properties
Sets the URL for serving uploaded resources from.

Sets or contains the label the property will use during editing.

On: Simple properties

Live: yes
